If you are a fan of classic 80's slasher flicks then DBD is a good game.

Its lost some of its gritty horror aesthetic in the name of PVP balance but the latest patch has reclaimed some of that. Killers are kind of scary again and trying to survive can be tricky but that's the idea.

The real drawback of the game is it player base they are among some of the most childish sore losers you'll ever encounter. If you can ignore that and just enjoy the game though it really is great.

They announced custom game bots were coming in the future allowing for an offline gameplay experience. I'm really looking forward to that as playing PVP can be exhausting when you have to interact with giant man babies every other game.

Quite a good game. It requires lots of mind game technique.

Really love the game with interesting killers and survivor.

I have a couple of problems that I know some are going to be added/modified. But for now;
-God awful matchmaking, I'm not high level at all and I'm still learning, 4 times I got a survive with friend ranked 2 to 4 with sweat build against me, a killer with no perk and barely know maps.
-There's some killer that I feel like they desperately need rework, but I don't know what could be done to help them I.E.; Trapper, wraith, Pig, Clown
-EAC will often cock you with an Error 4 (apparently I modified my game cash while I was in game?), happened 3 times. Dev's says it's often because of a faulty RAM, checked, my ram is fine. I looked into it and it's on their side, verify your cash every time there's an update, should deal with the problem.
-Toxic player base, either they troll you in game or they complain on the endgame screen, if they loose they'll berate you with insults, sometime I feel like they're the only ones that can have fun (as of yet I'm a killer main)

But even though I have my gripes with the game, god I just love the rush it gives you when you're in a chase and you're about to get your 4k, you know if this extend, they'll leave through the hatch and you'll be cursed with a 3k.
I just love the gratification it gives.

July 2020: I was abused by a racist player. DBD does not have safety nets in place to keep racists away. I was targeted because of my immense skills. I am sorry that I am just so good at this game. Would not recommend.... But I will continue playing, because I already have 90 hours, and my friends play it. DO NOT GET. Developers need to step it up... fr fr $$$$$$$$$$

October 2020: I am so good at this game that its frightening. But I was downed only because I checked an email, and the killer thought they were special. Its cute. Don't buy this game. But I will keep playing. DBD is like a wife of 50 years that I keep coming back to.

November 2020: I literally carried my team tonight, and got downed at the very end by a third-rate gamer. I absolutely despise this game. I am sorry that nobody can beat me because I am a literal god. I don't like the game still, but I will continue playing because I have come this far.

January 2021: So, its a new year, and the developers failed to surprise me yet again. The game remains a safe haven for racist players and cheaters who think they are good. My own teammate Ben passed the killer off to me like a cheese plate. Its just insane. I am literally the best thing that has ever happened to this game, and I feel like I get taken to the wood shed every time I launch the game. Another teammate Tyler can't get over his lag issues, and it brings down the other team members. He's a waste of space, as well as the others. God, I am so good! I would not suggest anyone buy this game. It is not worth the sweat. I will, however, continue playing because I've got nearly 100 hours, and to turn back now would be a major disservice to the DBD community {who needs me BADLY!].

January Part 2 2021: This game is broken. Total spaghetti code... I was struggling and the struggle didn't register. Devs need to fix this special needs game. Only reason I play is because my friends play. These people could not count on me to be here if it were not for my friends. This games needs a wheel chair.

Been playing this since day one as much as i love it as I have over 2000 hours total across platforms because you cant save progression across all systems (money grab) for BHVR but no surprise lack of professionalism in the sense of server balancing, punishment for bad behavior, and etc. If you enjoy being tunneled, camped, and on the other side of the coin dealing with some of the most toxic bases i have encountered in any game, this is your game, I can't pretend I won't play it anymore because it IS currently still the only game of its kind with a large player base and following, but when I see a better game come with similar style and of course a lot better graphics I won't have any issue dumping it, I mean it's 2022 BHVR maybe hire some new graphic designers and give us more realism in our characters appearances and our maps, it's taken you months just to do what you've done on the new haddonfield, kind of sad if you ask me. I wish they'd get their heads out of their a** and do more about these VPN users who play killer because of their massive advantages against us US players. Horror genre but the biggest horror is going against some guy named Chin Po whose ping is skyrocketing from 130-450 get your s*** together, while your following is large now there is a decline coming when VHS comes out and when other games of this style follow up, I have saw videos on Youtube of people using Unreal Engine to enhance and make this game look better, maybe if we are lucky they can release a game similar that throws your game out like trash, I have never had a game anger me quite as much as yours, I feel stress as survivor but that doesn't compare to the stress I feel as killer, makes it hard to want to play.

So far I've really liked this game. I will warn you that it can never be 100% balanced due to the nature of 1 v 4 games. Survivors in Discord calls with one another will make you question your existence as they wreck shop and there's basically nothing you can do about it. On the other hand, when you beat a friend group it makes you feel that much better at the game, so it's not all bad. The aesthetic and atmosphere of the game also brings a great presence to everything. When you're a survivor, it can be terrifying watching a killer walk towards you as you hide in an incredibly vulnerable spot only for them to walk right past you. It's exhilerating when you watch from afar as the killer goes across the map to find more victims while you go in to save your friend. And from the killer's perspective, you really do feel like this unstoppable badass with severe psychological trauma STRAIGHT out of a horror movie whose only goal in life is to murder innocent people. All-in-all, it's a great experience to have. Playing as different horror movie characters is pretty awesome too, but it does create a slight atmosphere of "pay to win" as people who buy more DLC have access to more perks than people that don't which gives them an advantage. The devs have to make money somehow though and thankfully they don't do it with lootboxes, so I give it a pass. Would reccommend!
